post_text:
GRANTED: Big kudos to Assistant Principal Sonya Oates for securing a $4,000 grant to help increase reading proficiency for students who are below grade level or having trouble reading!

" Leland Middle School began using Lexia Learning last year to increase our students’ critical reading and language skills," Assistant Principal Oates said.
"So, I searched for a grant that would allow us to purchase the Lexia Powerup Literacy resource to provide even more support to provide students with focused reading strategies, enrichment, & literacy interventions."

The grant is provided by the Dollar General Literacy Foundation. Thank YOU, DGLF! 👏👏👏

Mrs. Oates is now working with the Coyotes at the new Town Creek Middle School while continuing to have a meaningful impact with the Leland Middle School Tigers!

Nice Work, Mrs. Oates! 👏👏👏

#EmbraceTheNew
#AdaptingRespondingAndFlexibility
#BCSCommunityOfLearners

post_text:
CONGRATULATIONS: "Ms. Greene shows attitude through relentless positivity," her colleagues said in their nomination for Dessie Greene to be a BCS Employee of the Year.
"On the rare difficult days, her smile brightens the halls of Lincoln Elementary School and her students notice no change in her engagement with them. She believes that any student can meet expectations beyond what their IEP may state, and creates warm, safe, and inviting environments where students are supported to meet those goals."

A round of applause for the 2020-21 Brunswick County Schools Rookie of the Year, Dessie Greene! 👏👏👏

📸Left to Right: Executive Director of Professional Development and Elementary Education/District Beginning Teacher Coordinator Jen Damin, Principal Pamela Biggs, Resource Teacher of Exceptional Children Dessie Greene, Beginning Teacher Coordinator/Educator, Assistant Principal Amy Callahan-Hayes

#EmbraceTheNew
#AdaptingRespondingAndFlexibility
#BCSCommunityOfLearners

CONGRATULATIONS: "Erin has made a huge difference in her first year as a social worker serving Belville," one of her peers noted in their nomination for Erin Rutkowski to be selected as a BCS Employee of the Year.
"The work ethic she displays is unbelievable. Ms. Rutkowski's efforts have helped Belville reduce student absences by nearly 30%."

A round of applause for the 2020-21 Brunswick County Schools Instructional Support Employee of the Year, Erin Rutkowski! 👏👏👏

📸Left to Right: School Counselor Specialist Meredith Lloyd, Assistant Superintendent Darrell Cheers, Superintendent Dr. Jerry L. Oates, School Social Worker Erin Rutkowski, Assistant Superintendent Molly White.

Congratulations, Erin. You are changing lives!

#EmbraceTheNew

post_text:
THE WHEELS ON THE BUS: It will look a little different this year when the school buses start rolling with students on board when we begin the A/B Rotating Day Schedules. Routes are being finalized and should be available to you next week.

In this short video, we highlight a few of the bus ride changes this year that include:
🚌 Mask requirements
🚌 One student per seat, loading back to front and unloading front to back.
🚌 Temperature checks
🚌 Cleaning
🚌 Where to find route information

It will be a year of adjustments and just like the beginning of each school year when buses hit the roads, some extra patience will be needed as the community gets used to the added traffic in the mornings and afternoons.
Please keep your eye out for the big yellow buses that will be carrying our amazing students!

Closed Captioning: http://bit.ly/BusRiderInfoBCS

#EmbraceTheNew
#AdaptingRespondingAndFlexibility
#BCSCommunityOfLearners

VIRTUAL COLLEGE EXPLORATION: Beginning next week, there is a great way for high school students to learn about the college search process and numerous college opportunities available!

During the 4 week program hosted by the Carolinas Association of Collegiate Registrars and Admissions Officers (CACRAO), students can ask questions and interact with the college admission counselors from more than 200 colleges/universities.

Here's the link for more info: https://cacrao.org/programs/2020-high-school-student-registration

post_text:
TIP OF THE WEEK: The phenomenal BCS School Nurses are offering up a Tip(s) of the Week with helpful health related information throughout the school year.

👩‍⚕️This week the topic is WHAT IS TRUE EXPOSURE TO COVID 19?

"The Centers for Disease Control (CDC) defines exposure as the following: an individual who has had close contact (less than 6 feet) for 15 cumulative minutes or longer. This is why the 3 Ws are so important!

So remember, whether at work or in public, always…

👉W-Wear a cloth face covering over your nose and mouth
👉W-Wait at least 6 feet apart to avoid close contact
👉W-Wash your hands with soap and water, if available. If not available use hand sanitizer that contains at least 60% alcohol. Remember to especially wash your hands before removing or applying your face covering.

If we do these 3 things our likelihood of being exposed to COVID 19 are drastically decreased!"

#EmbraceTheNew
#AdaptingRespondingAndFlexibility
#BCSCommunityOfLearners

Bolivia Elementary School's Beverly Eury, BCS Principal of the Year
Belville Elementary School's Allie Dixon, BCS Assistant Principal of the Year
South Brunswick High School's Jennie Bryan, BCS Teacher of the Year

HERE WE GROW: Have you completed the 2020 Census?

The information collected will help shape Brunswick County's future for the next 10 years. 🌱-🌱🌱-🌱🌱🌱

The deadline to complete the 2020 Census is Sept. 30, 2020.

#CommunityOfLearners
shared_text:
Brunswick County Government
September 1 at 4:59 PM ·

We only have one month left to shape Brunswick County's future for the next 10 years. Make sure you fill out your 2020 Census by Sept. 30, 2020.

Complete your Census by mail, by phone, or online now at https://my2020census.gov/

Learn more at https://www.brunswickcountync.gov/census/

post_text:
NEED TO TALK? The Hope for NC Helpline is available 24 hours a day, 7 days a week if you need to talk about fear, stress, anxiety or other concerns as we navigate through the pandemic.

📞 Call 1-855-587-3463 to talk with someone about numerous topics including:
🟣 Feeling alone
🟣 Irritable
🟣 Head, stomach, or body aches
🟣 Changes in sleep or eating patterns
🟣 Difficulty concentrating, forgetful
🟣 Fear for your own health
🟣 Worried about the health of your family or friends
🟣 Increased used of alcohol, tobacco, or other drugs
🟣 Feeling stuck, no time for self-care
🟣 Looking for ideas to stay calm and healthy

post_text:
OVERHEARD ON TWITTER: "Embracing the new with an awesome group of Instructional Coaches," Executive Director of Professional Development and Elementary Education Jen Damin tweeted.

The insides of schools look a bit different this year. 👀
But one aspect that isn't different is the dedication to making each year, even challenging ones like 2020, the best possible for our students and staff. 😍

Continuous professional development that benefits everyone is 👌! 👏👏👏

#EmbraceTheNew
#AdaptingRespondingAndFlexibility
#BCSCommunityOfLearners

BEHIND THE SCENES: Checkout all this helpful information from the Leland Middle School Tigers as they continue to prepare for a mixture of face to face and remote learning instruction next month!

Look for more videos from our schools as we get closer to switching from 100% remote learning to the A/B Alternating Day Schedule on September 21st.
#EmbraceTheNew
#AdaptingRespondingAndFlexibility
#BCSCommunityOfLearners
shared_text:
Leland Middle School
August 28 at 2:05 PM ·

We have a few LMS updates! We are SO looking forward to our students returning to the building on September 21st (January 6th if you opted for semester-long remote learning) and showing some #LMSTigerPride

1. Letters were mailed yesterday with your child's A/B schedule.

2. Please make sure you contact magee@bcswan.net if you need bus transportation and have not signed up this year.

3. We appreciate all you are doing to help your child be successful! We know this is hard. 💜 Please be sure to check grades weekly--we have a lot of students who are participating in one or two classes, but not all four cores. Please encourage your child to attend all classes, every day.

EMBRACING THE NEW: We all know there will be learning curves and bumps in the road as we navigate through this beginning of a school year we've never seen before.

But...we also know each day it gets better as we learn what works and learn what doesn't work. We also know this is temporary.

Thank you, EVERYONE, for being a Community of Learners. 🤗

📸 Superintendent Dr. Oates making the rounds and checking in with the West Brunswick High School Trojans.

#EmbraceTheNew
#AdaptingRespondingAndFlexibility
#BCSCommunityOfLearners

post_text:
CONGRATULATIONS: A BIG round of applause for Amanda Richardson for being named the 2020-2021 Clyde Davis RAC 5 LEA Testing Coordinator of the Year! 👏👏👏

Testing Coordinators oversee all aspects of testing in the schools and Amanda Richardson does a PHENOMENAL job at it. Her peers in the Southeast Region definitely think so!

Associate Superintendent of Cumberland County Schools and Chair of Awards Committee Ron Phipps drove down for the surprise announcement! 🎉

📸: Left to Right: CCS Associate Superintendent Ron Phipps, BCS Assistant Superintendent Darrell Cheers, Director of Testing and Data Management Amanda Richardson, BCS Superintendent Dr. Jerry L. Oates.
#EmbraceTheNew
#AdaptingRespondingAndFlexibility
#BCSCommunityOfLearners

post_text:
GETTING READY TO RIDE: Is your child going to be riding a school bus when we transition to an A/B Alternating Day schedule (mixture of face to face and remote learning) on September 21st?

We are putting together routes and need to know where to go!
⚠️Please let your child's school know by September 2nd if bus service is needed.
🗣Pssst...We can make adjustments down the road, but the deadline of September 2nd is the only way to guarantee pickup the initial week of September 21st.

School contact numbers: https://bit.ly/BCSPhoneNumbers

#EmbraceTheNew
#AdaptingRespondingAndFlexibility
#BCSCommunityOfLearners

CONGRATULATIONS: He's no stranger to Brunswick County Schools. A BIIIIG round of applause for now LIEUTENANT Adam Stanley, who oversees nearly two dozen Brunswick County Sheriff's Office, NC SROs in the school district. 👏👏👏

Did you know that BCS has at least one School Resource Officer in each school(2 in the high schools) and all are certified in crisis intervention. (🗣Pssst: They're also big time role models for our students and staff).

Congratulations on the promotion, Lt. Stanley!
#BCSComunityOfLearners
#BCSShoutout

August 24 at 8:48 PM ·

post_text:
TIP OF THE WEEK: The phenomenal BCS School Nurses are offering up Tip(s) of the Week with helpful health related information throughout the school year.

👩‍⚕️ First up is for the folks already in the buildings:

"Please remember to follow district guidelines regarding the 3 Ws (Wear, Wait and Wash).
Wearing a mask, social distancing and washing your hands helps to protect you and others.
Masks are required for all staff members while on school grounds unless you are working privately in your classroom, office or designated workspace.
Let's set a good example for our students and community by following these simple safety guidelines to keep everyone healthy.
Wearing a mask may seem trivial to some, but for others, it could be a matter of life or death."

📞 School Nurse Contact Info: http://bit.ly/BCSSchoolNurses

www.bcswan.net
www.bcswan.net/ReopeningInformation
www.bcswan.net/RemoteLearning
#EmbraceTheNew
#AdaptingRespondingAndFlexibility
#BCSCommunityOfLearners

post_text:
NUMBER CRUNCH: It is busy, busy as we make sure students, staff, and parents get tech related issues resolved as soon as possible. We're here for yoU!

Adapting:
👉 3,882 phone calls were made to the BCS Help Desk the first week of school (8/17-8/21) for help troubleshooting while we're in a remote learning atmosphere. 😅

Responding:
👉 More than 9,500 devices, like Chromebooks, have been given out to students to assist with remote learning and we are fortunate and prepared should another student need one, too.

Flexibility:
👉 There will be bumps in the road we can repair and plenty of learning on all levels as we progress through this historical school year, but one thing is for sure...
...we'll #EmbraceTheNew, Together.

Thank you for patience and understanding, BCS Family.
FYI, the extended Help Desk hours:
Monday-Friday 7:30AM-8:00PM
📞 Call- 910-253-1095
✉️ Email- helpdesk@bcswan.net

www.bcswan.net
www.bcswan.net/ReopeningInformation
www.bcswan.net/RemoteLearning
#EmbraceTheNew
#AdaptingRespondingAndFlexibility
#BCSCommunityOfLearners

post_text:
NEED TO TALK? BCS Student Support Services has numerous resources to help students and parents as we continue to adjust to the impacts of the Coronavirus.

Behavior Specialists ✔️
School Counselors ✔️
School Psychologists ✔️
School Nurses ✔️
School Social Workers ✔️
Dropout Prevention Specialists ✔️
👆 are all available for support in the social-emotional learning and mental health needs of the school community.

ATHLETICS UPDATE: An update on projected High School/Middle School sports schedules was presented during the 8/18 Committee Meetings.

It included voluntary workout schedules beginning *outdoor only* August 24th and adjusting September 22nd with current state guidelines in place at that time(Phase 2,3, etc).

👉 Here's the link to the projected schedules and the presentation itself: https://bit.ly/BCSAthleticsUpdate

Please contact your child's coach for more information specific to your child's sport and times/dates of voluntary workouts.

⚠️All schedules are assuming that there are no changes in guidance from state officials regarding COVID-19.

post_text:
THANK YOU: Thank you for hanging in there, BCS Family, as we officially stepped into the 2020-21 school year. You did good. Real good.

Districts across the state were hit with the same log-in issues to start the 1st Day of School after a state-wide glitch with NCEdCloud. We're told the vendor will be providing NCDPI an explanation of the root cause once it has identified the source.

But let's not let that overshadow everyone stepping up together. 👏👏👏
You did good. Real good.
We appreciate YOU. 🤗

www.bcswan.net
www.bcswan.net/ReopeningInformation
www.bcswan.net/RemoteLearning
#EmbraceTheNew
#AdaptingRespondingAndFlexibility

STUDENT MEALS: The current curbside pickup student meal program at the 3 high school locations will be in place through August 31.

🍏 SBHS: 280 Cougar Drive, BSL Southport

Check out the Remote Learning Plans for the West Brunswick High School Trojans!
(More info on their school Facebook page)
shared_text:
DOCS.GOOGLE.COM
West Brunswick High School Remote Learning Plan - Student Version

West Brunswick High School Trojans
August 7 at 10:14 PM ·

Fellow Trojans! Welcome to the 2020-2021 school year!

Over the summer, West Brunswick High School created a school-based reopening team called Best for West. During the process, our team identified three guiding principles to lead the decision making: Health and Safety, Student Success, Quality Teaching and Learning. Here you will find the Best for West Remote Learning Plan.

Our school community represents the best of Brunswick County, and I know that we will move as ONE West during the 2020-2021 school year.

Let's move as ONE West!
#TrojanPride

Here you will find the Best for West Remote Learning Plan.

Our school community represents the best of Brunswick County, and I know that we will move as ONE West during the 2020-2021 school year.

Let's move as ONE West!
#TrojanPride

https://docs.google.com/document/d/e/2PACX-1vQ9OFS9fFsjq9jSvA8GAJO9-lrL4nDDm9bNf031dnAEPvo53998Nbxh22Z5obouVh4LkJukaIwEyG-_/pub

All schools operate on normal hours beginning 8/10/2020!

post_text:
CONTACT: Have you changed phone numbers, email address, home address, etc?

At minimum, you should be getting phone calls once a week from the district. So if 910-253-2900 hasn't shown up on your caller ID lately, there's a chance you're missing out on important updates. If in doubt, please call your child's school to confirm your contact information is correct. (8/7/2020 is the final day of the summer schedule where schools are closed on Fridays, but we'll be back to assist you first thing 8/10/20 morning)

(🗣 Psst: If you've blocked the phone calls in the past, you can call 855-502-7867 to opt back in to receiving them. Just make sure you call from the phone number on file.)

📞 Here's a list of the phone numbers to all 20 Brunswick County Schools:
https://bit.ly/BCSPhoneNumbers

#AdaptingRespondingAndFlexibility
#BCSCommunityOfLearners

SUMMER MEALS: The phenomenal Brunswick County Schools Child Nutrition staff is back and ready to serve our students! 💞

You can pick up free student meals today and Thursday, 11am-1pm, at our three high school locations. (Friday meals will be handed out on Thursday)
🍎 NBHS: 114 Scorpion Drive Leland
🍊 WBHS: 550 Whiteville Road Shallotte
🍏 SBHS: 280 Cougar Drive, BSL Southport

COMIDAS DE VERANO: Puede recoger comidas gratis para estudiantes hoy y jueves, de 11 a.m. a 1 p.m., en nuestras tres ubicaciones de la escuela secundaria. (Los viernes las comidas se entregarán los jueves)

Additional Food Service information here:
http://nokidhungrync.org/covid19/

post_text:
WEATHER IMPACTS: BCS Family, due to the potential overnight tropical weather impacts in Brunswick County, the following events have been rescheduled/canceled.
👉 8/4/2020 Board of Education Meeting will now take place on Monday, 8/10/2020 at Central Services at 6pm. We will Livestream the meeting.
👉 Curbside Student Meal Pickup Service at the 3 high school locations has been canceled for 8/4/2020. We expect to resume on Wednesday barring any weather related issues that need to be addressed at the schools.

Thank you and please stay safe, make sure you are monitoring weather conditions overnight, and visit https://www.brunswickcountync.gov/emergency/hurricanes/ for helpful information related to tropical weather threats.

post_text: 👇 Know Your Zone 👇
shared_text:
Brunswick County Government
August 1 at 1:20 PM ·

In the event of an evacuation, make sure you Know Your Zone. Local officials will determine which areas should be evacuated based on a zone area's risk for storm surge and flooding. Find your zone based on your address: knowyourzone.nc.gov

Conozca Su Zona/Know Your Zone es un sistema de evacuación escalonado que muestra las áreas de más peligro a los impactos de huracanes, tormentas tropicales y de otros daños. Las zonas de evacuación resaltan las áreas con mayor riesgo de marejadas e inundaciones: https://www.ncdps.gov/es/conozca-su-zona

Brunswick County Hurricane Info: brunswickcountync.gov/hurricanes/ #Isaias

post_text:
TRANSPORTATION SURVEY: (Espanol:https://bit.ly/encuestadetransporteBCS)

We need to begin gathering information on who will need school bus transportation from home to school and back once the district begins an A/B schedule.

(An A/B schedule will consist of a mixture of remote learning and face-to-face instruction.)

If your child is NOT participating in the 1st Semester 100% Remote Learning opportunity and will be returning to schools when we begin an A/B schedule, please take this short survey:

TRANSPORTATION SURVEY: https://bit.ly/BusTransportationSurvey

This information will help the transportation department develop routes for students who will need bus transportation to and from school once we begin an A/B schedule.

Make sure to visit 'District News' on the main page of www.bcswan.net, as well as www.bcswan.net/Reopening Information for updates on th 2020-2021 school year.

post_text:
BCS Family,
We are getting numerous complaints and concerns regarding inappropriate public comments on the BCS Facebook page.

Literally everyone is beyond stressed right now but "abusive" and "threatening" language takes away from real conversations. (those are two of the most common descriptions of recent comments under the Facebook posts)

Please keep comments constructive. We can all get our diverse points, concerns, kudos and complaints across without having to use profanity or abusive language.

Keep in mind, children also have access to reading these comments.

Be kind.
Thank you.
-Daniel Seamans, BCS Communications

post_text:
UPDATE: BCS Family, we now have a better idea of how many students will be returning to face to face instruction after the 4.5 weeks of 100% remote learning to begin the 2020-21 school year.

(Edit: About 3,500 students/parents/guardians signed up for the full semester of remote learning by the 7/23 deadline. This means about 9,000 students would return to the classroom under an A/B Plan after 4.5 weeks of remote learning.)

👉 The information is being used to develop the best A/B Plan where students rotate face to face and remote learning instruction.
👉 Superintendent Dr. Jerry L. Oates will present the A/B DAY Plan to the school board at the August 4 Board of Education meeting for consideration to put the A/B DAY Plan in place after the initial 4.5 weeks of remote learning.
👉 Please bookmark www.bcswan.net/ReopeningInformation and www.bcswan.net/RemoteLearning for continuous updates as we near the start of the school year.

Thank you for your patience under these totally understandable stressing times.
#AdaptingRespondingAndFlexibility
#BCSCommunityOfLearners

SPREAD THE WORD: We're putting together a countywide list of open, content-filtered WiFi locations for BCS students and childcare options available on Remote Learning Days.
👉 Businesses with WiFi location availability
👉 Churches with WiFi location availability
👉 Community/Recreation centers with WiFi location availability
👉 Childcare businesses who have availability

We'll routinely share the options on our communication outlets to help provide available resources offered by community organizations and businesses while we are in a remote learning status.

Thank YOU!

DATE FOR PLAN B DECISION: BCS Family, we expect a decision to be made at next Tuesday's Committee Meetings (7/21) regarding which Plan B option will be used to begin the school year. The meeting will be livestreamed and we will announce the selection afterwards.

⚠️To give you additional time to review, the deadline to apply for the Remote Learning Option is being postponed 24 hours to Thursday, July 23rd at 8am. So please take this time to consider all options.

We'll announce what Plan B option board members selected Tuesday evening after the committee meetings. Then you'll have an additional 24 hours to apply for the remote learning option or decide to take part in the Plan B in-class option that will be announced on July 21.

💻📱To apply for the remote learning option, visit this link: https://bit.ly/ApplyForRemoteLearning

post_text:
ATHLETICS UPDATE: Right now, Voluntary Summer Workouts for Brunswick County Schools are still paused until further notice but we wanted to pass along some news from the state level.

The NCHSAA Board of Directors just approved the following rule and calendar changes:

👉The start of NCHSAA fall sports is delayed until at least September 1.
👉The first five (5) student days of the 2020-2021 school year will be designated as a “dead period” for ALL sports, allowing school staff to focus on the start of school.
👉NCHSAA Phase One of the summer conditioning and workouts will continue until further notice.

We'll pass along new developments specific to BCS sports/extracurricular activities as soon as they are available.

#BCSCommunityOfLearners

APPLY FOR REMOTE LEARNING: Survey link below.
(Espanol: https://bit.ly/Encuestadeaprendizajeremoto)

BCS needs to gather critical information for students/parents/guardians who are requesting 100% Remote Learning for the 2020-2021 school year. The Remote Learning Option will be a commitment for one semester.

Definition: In NC K-12 public schools, remote learning is defined as learning that takes place outside of the traditional school setting using various media and formats, such as but not limited to: video conference, telephone conference, print material, online material, or learning management systems.

⚠️You do NOT need to fill out this remote learning survey if your child will be participating in in-class instruction at a school location.

👉 APPLY HERE: https://bit.ly/ApplyForRemoteLearning

⚠️Deadline is July 22nd, 8am.

post_text:
TROJAN PRIDE: #TrojanPride continues as Mr. Jonathan Paschal will be taking over Principalship of the West Brunswick High School Trojans in the 2020-2021 school year!

Want to know more about this Trojan? 😃

👉Jonathan Paschal earned his Bachelor's Degree in Mathematics from the University of North Carolina Wilmington and began his teaching career at New Hanover High School.
👉In 2015, he was accepted into the North Carolina Principal Fellows Program.
👉In 2017, he earned a Masters of School Administration from the University of North Carolina Wilmington.
👉Mr. Paschal has served West Brunswick High School as an assistant principal over the past three years.
👉His wonderful wife and two sweet boys are truly excited to continue their support of the Trojans. They have been to countless games and events as a part of the Trojan family.

The familiar face at West is destined to bring out the best in the Trojans.
Congratulations, Mr. Paschal! 👏👏👏

post_text:
PLAN B SURVEY: (Versión en español: https://bit.ly/EncuestaespañolaPlanB)

BCS Family, we continue to modify potential Plan A, B, C reopening plans as we wait for further guidance from Governor Cooper.

Plan B is by far the most complicated and we have several variations of what it could look like. We want to get your feedback on some *possible PLAN B options (mix of remote and in class instruction) that would likely involve a 50% reduction in building and transportation capacity.

We also need to know which families are likely to look for education options that do NOT include Brunswick County Schools.

The survey is simple. Details of the options are in the survey description and then you select which one you would feel most comfortable with in the question to follow. This is just to gauge the interests in potential PLAN B options for further research.

👉SURVEY: https://bit.ly/SurveyPlanBOptions or
https://bit.ly/PlanBOptionsSurvey
shared_text:
BCSWAN.NET
SURVEY: Possible PLAN B Options

ATHLETICS UPDATE: Brunswick County Schools will not begin Voluntary Summer Workouts for Athletics until at least July 20, 2020.

On June 24th, Governor Cooper extended Phase 2 status through July 17th. We will use information from state health officials, expected to be announced the week of July 13-17, to determine when it is safe to resume voluntary workouts.
The start date will be no earlier than 7/20/2020.

More details here: https://bit.ly/BCSAthleticsUpdate

#BCSCommunityOfLearners

LIVING DOCUMENT: NC Public Schools has put together an interactive 'Living Document' that details the current guidance on reopening public schools in our state.
*EDIT: Governor Cooper and state health officials are expected to announce which plan(A, B, or C detailed in the documents below) all public schools will operate under by July 1st.

👉 Living Document: https://bit.ly/LightingOurWayForward2020
👉 Alternative link for those having problems accessing interactive 'Living Document' https://bit.ly/ReopeningGuidancePDF (135 pages)

The 'Living Document' has links within' it with additional details on specific topics.
Take a look here: https://bit.ly/LightingOurWayForward2020 or alternative link for those having issues with 'Living Document' here: https://bit.ly/ReopeningGuidancePDF

HEADS UP: Parents of rising 4th-8th graders should be hearing from their school regarding placement in their 2020-2021 math class in the near future.

📸 Pictured is an example/sample letter of what will be mailed to you from the school your child is attending.
📄 After reviewing the letter sent from your school, there will be an additional form included that parents/guardians can complete if they are not satisfied with the child's math placement.
📞 If you have any questions, please give your child's school a call and staff will be happy to assist.
Thank YOU!
#BCSCommunityOfLearners

ATHLETICS UPDATE: The excitement continues to build for Summer sports and practices and we wanted to give you an update on where we are in regards to returning to the field, so to speak.

👉Brunswick County Schools is currently putting plans together to make it possible for Summer athletic practices to resume. Student and staff safety is the priority and we will not begin Summer practices until we have the proper return-to-activity protocols in place.

👉Athletic Directors along with school and district administrators will use the week of June 15th to obtain the necessary protective supplies and train coaches on new protocols in order to keep student athletics and staff safe as we adapt to the challenges of COVID19.

You can find more information here 👇: https://bit.ly/BCSAthleticsUpdateJune

post_text:
SUMMER SCHEDULE: The Summer Schedule for BCS is now in place through August 7th. The 4 day work week reduces summer energy consumption across the district and saves 💵.
How does it affect you?
💒 School buildings are closed to walk in traffic but you can call and make an appointment so that we can safely meet your needs and limit the amount of traffic inside the buildings at this time.
🍎The Summer Meals Program is currently underway at the three high schools. Student meals can be picked up Monday through Thursday, 11am-1pm, with meals for Friday and Monday being given out on Thursday's pickup.

You can find more information here: https://bit.ly/BCSSummerSchedule2020

GRADUATION: 🎓🎉🎓🎉 Once the 💿 are ready, we'll get them out to the schools for pickup.
There will also be a Youtube link for each school's service and we'll share when it is available so you can share with family and friends.
In the meantime, here's the rundown for viewing on ATMC TV!
📹Saturday, June 6th at 7 pm: Brunswick County Early College High School
📹Sunday, June 7th at 7 pm: South Brunswick High School
📹Monday, June 8th at 7 pm: North Brunswick High School
📹Tuesday, June 9th at 7 pm: West Brunswick High School
After their premieres, graduations will re-air on ATMC TV throughout June as follows: Saturdays - Early College; Sundays - South Brunswick; Mondays - North Brunswick; and Tuesdays - West Brunswick. All airings are at 7pm.

post_text:
****UPDATE****
On 6/2/2020, Brunswick County Schools was made aware of an inappropriate social media post by an individual who was believed to be an employee of the school system. Upon investigation by Human Resources, it was determined that the individual had previously been a substitute teacher in the district, but submitted her resignation via Substitute Teacher Intent Form on May 26.

Since that time, she has not been an employee of Brunswick County Schools. We appreciate everyone being patient while the investigation was completed.

The school system is committed to being a community of diversity, inclusion, and respect for each and every person.

Original post:
BCS Family,
We are aware of a social media post from a BCS employee circulating that does not represent the values and beliefs of our school system.

We are investigating the issue and appreciate those who have brought it to our attention. Brunswick County Schools is a community of diversity, inclusion, and respect for each and every person.

Again, thank you for bringing it to our attention.

post_text:
FYI: ATMC is offering the 50 Mbps high-speed internet service at a reduced monthly price of $29.95, for six months, to households with children grades K-12 or in college who do not already have a broadband subscription.

This offer will also be available for customers who are currently receiving the free student internet offer, once their 60 day free period expires.

Regular internet prices will apply after the six-month promotional period. To find out if ATMC services are available in your area, call ATMC at 910-754-4311, Monday through Friday, 8 am to 6 pm.

PARENT SURVEY: We want to hear from YOU!

Due to the COVID-19 school closure, students were offered the opportunity to participate in Remote Learning.

The following survey will help us learn from this experience and improve our service during any future school closings. If possible, please complete a survey for each student in your home if your experience differs per child. If you would like to provide specific teacher feedback, please email your child's principal. Thank you for sharing your experience!

👉Survey Link: https://bit.ly/ParentSurveyRemoteLearning

HERE'S YOUR SIGN: May 18th is National Speech Language Pathologist Day and May is Better Hearing & Speech Month!

Brunswick County Schools Speech-Language Pathologists diagnose and treat communication disorders.
They help students:
🍎Say sounds
🍎Understand meaning
🍎Speak smoothly
🍎Use their voice
🍎Use alternative means of communication
🍎and help with numerous other skills!

As you can see in the photo, Brunswick County Schools SLPs sure love and miss their students!

#BCSCommunityOfLearners

post_text:
ENCORE, ENCORE: North Brunswick High School Choral Director Samantha Childers and her students have been working on a Virtual Choir and here's their debut! 🎼

🗣"The piece we are singing is called 'Oye' by Jim Papoulis," Ms Childers said. "The piece is partially in Spanish and partially in English and the lyrics share a wonderful message about listening to each other and making your voice heard. This was one of my student's favorite pieces we were working on and I think it is a wonderful message for our current situation."

Closed Captioning here: https://bit.ly/NBHSOyeCC

Bravo, Scorpions, BRAVO! 👏👏👏
#BCSCommunityOfLearners

P-EBT BENEFIT UPDATE: BCS Family, there appears to be an issue with the initial communication from the state for recipients of the P-EBT cards soon to be sent out.
Here is the statement from NCDHHS:
👇
“We are aware of the issue of emergency contacts receiving P-EBT notices. P-EBT cards have not yet been mailed. Updated school files will be used to mail new notices with instructions for activating cards. We will also use this updated file for mailing the actual P-EBT card.”

👉You can find more information on the P-EBT Benefits here:
https://bit.ly/PEBTQuestionsAndAnswers

School Counselors ✔️
School Psychologists ✔️
School Nurses ✔️
School Social Workers ✔️

or here 👉 https://www.bcswan.net/Page/3665

post_text:
IN OTTER NEWS: Josh the Baby Otter is very popular with the little ones in Brunswick County Schools and brings with him a very important message about water safety. Check out the special video reading of Josh the Baby Otter courtesy of the Jack Helbig Memorial Foundation!

(and if you have a Class of 2033 little one...you can register for Kindergarten online via this link: https://www.bcswan.net/Domain/865 )
shared_text:
YOUTUBE.COM
JOSH THE BABY OTTER BOOK VIDEO

Jack Helbig Memorial Foundation
May 6 at 6:52 PM ·

Normally in the spring JHMF would be visiting all of our local kindergarten classrooms to present Josh the Baby Otter and teach about being safe around water. We really miss seeing those little ones this year!

Here is a video of the story, Josh the Baby Otter, that we read to kindergarten. Please watch with your littles- great for ages 2-7 years. After the story take the Josh the Otter Water Safety Pledge together. For more otter fun, make the Josh the Otter puppet. Link will be in comments below. Look for the free mobile Josh the Otter app as well!

We hope you enjoy these activities with your kids and that they help reinforce the lesson that they should never go near water without an adult.

Josh the Otter Float 4 Life
Brunswick County Schools

post_text:
THANK YOU: School Nurses help connect providers, parents and communities to help improve student attendance and health.

Today is National School Nurse Day, established in 1972, and we are so THANKFUL to have such a dedicated team of nurses in the district. They help turn 🤧 into 😀!

The theme this year is "School Nurses: Supporting Students in Times of Crisis" and it resonates big time as we navigate through the COVID19 crisis here and a far.

Need to talk to a BCS School Nurse? Contact information here: https://bit.ly/StudentSupportCOVID19

#BCSCommunityOfLearners

post_text:
GRADUATION UPDATE: At the May 5th, 2020 Board of Education Meeting, Board Members heard from several students in regards to holding a traditional graduation for each high school later in the year/Fall.

🎓After discussion, Board Members decided to move forward with the current plan later this month(mix of receiving diploma in person and video speeches edited into a special service) as well as hold a traditional graduation ceremony at a later date to be determined.

🗓The plans and timing of the second traditional graduations will follow guidance from state health officials as to when it is safe for large crowds to gather.

🎓Current Class of 2020 plans: https://bit.ly/BCSGraduationUpdate2020

📹You can watch the 5/5/2020 BOE meeting via this link:https://bit.ly/May5BOEMeeting

It is #TeacherAppreciationWeek2020 and we sure appreciate such kind thoughts and deeds from #OurNCSchoolsHereos! 🥰🥰🥰

👇
Feel free to share the inspiration for all of us to read 🥰!!

post_text:
WINNER WINNER: Addy and sister Scarlet of Virginia Williamson Elementary School (Ms. Huggin's kindergarten class) can proudly proclaim themselves winners of the 'Recycle,Reuse, and Reimagine' book reading contest! 🎉🎉🎉

In celebration of National School Library Month, schools have been celebrating with a fun contest that has an Earth Day theme of "Recycle, Reuse, and Reimagine". Students chose a book and created a display that represented the storyline using materials around the house and yard.

Addy's display garnered the most social media love for the contest and we just LOVE the excitement with reading! 👏👏👏

#BCSCommunityOfLearners

THANK YOU: It's #SchoolLunchHeroDay and we certainly have heroes in Brunswick County Schools! 👏👏👏

🤜 The Child Nutrition Department staff is serving up about 23,000 meals a week to make sure our students get breakfast and lunch while the cafeterias are closed.

Thank YOU, BCS School Lunch Heroes! 🤗
#BCSCommunityOfLearners

SCHOLARSHIP OPPORTUNITY: From Brunswick Electric Membership Corporation 👇

ATTENTION HIGH SCHOOL SENIORS: May 6th is the new deadline to submit Scholarship Highway applications. If your guidance counselor has your application packet, they will ensure delivery. There are two options for students in possession of their packet; hand-deliver to one of our district office drive-throughs or mail it to the following address:
BEMC
Attn: Sherry Skumanick
PO Box 826
Shallotte, NC 28459
If you have any questions or concerns, please email sherry.skumanick@bemc.org or call (800) 842-5871.
Applications must be received by 5 p.m. May 6th to be eligible.

post_text:
NOW SERVING SMILES: The Child Nutrition Department is serving up thousands of meals a day to make sure students have meals while the school buildings are closed.

📸The picture is of a 'Thank You' card given to staff on one of the buses today. 🥰
💻The kind words below come from a social media message received yesterday:
"To the wonderful people who continue to make breakfast and lunch for the kids... THANK YOU!!! I have 5 boys, and lunch is delivered to us Monday through Friday. It is such a blessing!! And my kids are beyond ecstatic about it. They love finding out what is served daily, and they do happy dances, no joke!!!
Thank you all, for all you do!!! Thank you for the food that makes my boys happy!"🥰

Remember, you can pick up student meals Monday through Friday at the three high schools from 11am to 1pm. Just let the staff know how many student meals you need, no reservation needed. (and thank you, BCS Family, for such kind words and creative cards for our dedicated staff ❤️)

O....M....❤️
#BCSCommunityOfLearners

HERE FOR YOU: BCS Student Support Services has numerous resources to help students and parents as we continue to adjust to the impacts of the Coronavirus.

Behavior Specialists ✔️
School Counselors ✔️
School Psychologists ✔️
School Nurses ✔️
School Social Workers ✔️
Dropout Prevention Specialists ✔️
👆 are all available for support in the social-emotional learning and mental health needs of the school community.

Contact info here 👉 https://www.bcswan.net/Page/3665
or 👉https://bit.ly/StudentSupportCOVID19

#BCSCommunityOfLearners

FINAL COUNTDOWN: We're closing out 'School Library Month' this week and there is still time to show support for all these talented students with their book displays!

It's an Earth Day themed contest of "Recycle, Reuse, Reimagine" that wraps up April 30th 🌎📖

#BCSCommunityOfLearners
shared_text:
Brunswick County Schools added 20 new photos to the album: Reuse, Recycle, Re-imagine Contest.
April 23 at 1:02 PM ·

CREATIVE CONTEST: In celebration of National School Library Month, schools have been celebrating with a fun contest that has an Earth Day theme of "Recycle, Reuse, and Reimagine".

Students chose a book and created a display that represented the storyline using materials around the house and yard.
Here are the entries we received.
Make sure to like your favorite photo by April 30th and the student with the most 'likes' will get a special shoutout for their creative imagination!

(WoW, this is going to be a tough one with so many FANTASTIC entries!)

#BCSCommunityOfLearners

Make sure to like your favorite photo by April 30th and the student with the most 'likes' will get a special shoutout for their creative imagination!

(WoW, this is going to be a tough one with so many FANTASTIC entries!)

#BCSCommunityOfLearners

post_text:
MEAL LOCATOR: NC Public Schools and the NC Department of Health and Human Services has rolled out a 877-877 Meal Locator Texting Resource for Parents and Guardians.

Families who need help finding meals for their children ages 18 and younger can text FOODNC to 877-877 to locate nearby free meal sites. The texting service is also available in Spanish by texting COMIDA to 877-877. El servicio de mensajes de texto también está disponible en español enviando mensajes de texto a COMIDA al 877-877.

After entering their address, families will receive a text with the location and serving times for nearby pick-up and drive-thru meal sites while schools are closed. Sites have been set up across the state with school and community partners.

SPRING BREAK: BCS Family, thank you for adapting and working with us over the past few weeks as we get through these challenging times, T❤️gether.

A couple notes as we head into Spring Break:
👉As different as it is this year, enjoy the downtime. Unplug. Focus on family. Focus on you. We all deserve it.
👉Student Meal Services will pause on Good Friday and will resume on Monday, April 13th, during Spring Break.

Should there be any major announcements, we will post them here on Facebook as well as the home to all District News, www.bcswan.net.

As Superintendent Dr. Oates has said over the past weeks, we are all struggling, but we need to make sure we 'struggle well'. ❤️

We will struggle well, T❤️gether.

#BCSCommunityOfLearners

post_text:
STUDENT MEALS SERVICES: ❓Question: "I preordered student meals online for next week, now what?"

✅Answer: Right now, the Transportation Department is putting together next week's bus stop times and locations for everyone who signed up this week by the Wednesday deadline. It will take a couple days to coordinate the routes.

👉DO THIS: On Saturday or Sunday, everyone who preordered meals online will need to put their address into the bus route information link (found here: https://bit.ly/BCSBusRoutesNewLocations or http://media.bcswan.net/liveweb/webquery/ ) to get the updated times and locations for pickup for next week.

⚠️Please wait until the weekend to check for times and locations for next week.
Example: If you signed up on Tuesday, you will need to check the website on Saturday or Sunday for the updated routes.

Thank you for your patience and understanding as we put together the safest routes and locations together. You can find additional information at www.bcschildnutrition.com

post_text:
BY THE NUMBERS: It's National School Library Month! 📚
Curious about Brunswick County Schools Media Centers?

Here's some stats worth celebrating:🎉
📕 There are 273,312 print books in BCS libraries including 197,511 titles circulated this year
📗 Many are home to Makerspaces. What's that? Makerspaces allow students to engineer, create, design and develop products and ideas
📘 The BCS Digital Library has circulated 26,943 eBooks so far this school year and tracked 8,786 reading hours

Want to know more about the BCS Digital Library?
Click here: http://bit.ly/DigitalLibraryExpansion

#BCSCommunityOfLearners

post_text:
NATIONAL ASSISTANT PRINCIPALS WEEK: 🖊 Ode to BCS Assistant Principals...

They keep our Sharks and Stingrays swimming,
our Starfish shining bright,
They make sure Dolphins are always dancing,
and help Eagles fly to new heights.

First mates on board the Pirate's ship,
giving Patriots reason to be proud,
We see them spreading the Trojan pride,
and leading Leopards on the prowl.

They are a powerful chomp for the Gators,
the Tigers hear their echoing roar,
they lead Cougars out the den,
and spread wings so the Firebirds soar.

They are a stinging success for the Scorps,
provide the Bears enormous strength,
the COAST is powerful destination,
and they take a Bulldog's leash off to explore to great feats.

Our Assistant Principals do so much for the students,
we see it in everything they do.
You are appreciated and making a difference to young minds,
Seriously, Thank You.
👏👏👏
-BCS Family
#BCSCommunityOfLearners

LEADING LEOPARDS: We are extremely proud to announce that Interim Principal Pam Biggs is no longer Interim Principal at Lincoln Elementary School.

SHE'S NOW OFFICIALLY *THE* PRINCIPAL OF THE LINCOLN LEOPARDS! 🤗🐆😀

Want to know more about this phenomenal leader?

👉Pam Biggs earned her Bachelor's Degree in Elementary Education from the University of NC at Wilmington in 1993 and began teaching in Sampson County.
👉She taught elementary and middle school for 18 years in Brunswick and New Hanover Counties and is certified by the National Board for Professional Teaching Standards.
👉In 2013 she earned her Master's Degree in Executive Leadership from Gardner-Webb University.
👉Mrs. Biggs has been an assistant principal at South Brunswick High School and Belville Elementary School and served as interim principal at Lincoln Elementary since January. (where the positive impact was immediately felt)

We know the Lincoln Family is as excited as we are about this new appointment. Well deserved, Mrs. Biggs!

#BCSShoutout!
text:
LEADING LEOPARDS: We are extremely proud to announce that Interim Principal Pam Biggs is no longer Interim Principal at Lincoln Elementary School.

SHE'S NOW OFFICIALLY *THE* PRINCIPAL OF THE LINCOLN LEOPARDS! 🤗🐆😀

Want to know more about this phenomenal leader?

👉Pam Biggs earned her Bachelor's Degree in Elementary Education from the University of NC at Wilmington in 1993 and began teaching in Sampson County.
👉She taught elementary and middle school for 18 years in Brunswick and New Hanover Counties and is certified by the National Board for Professional Teaching Standards.
👉In 2013 she earned her Master's Degree in Executive Leadership from Gardner-Webb University.
👉Mrs. Biggs has been an assistant principal at South Brunswick High School and Belville Elementary School and served as interim principal at Lincoln Elementary since January. (where the positive impact was immediately felt)

We know the Lincoln Family is as excited as we are about this new appointment. Well deserved, Mrs. Biggs!

#BCSShoutout!

BY THE NUMBERS: Curious what students and staff have been up to over the past two weeks?
(👏👏👏 Bravo, BCS Family, BRAVO! 👏👏👏)

👉4,287 devices distributed to students
👉77% of K-8 students have logged on to educational resources(90% of students at Jessie Mae Monroe Elementary!)
👉2,652 Digital Books checked out with 1,131 hours spent reading
👉2,649 Virtual meetings conducted with 26,599 participants and more than 1,000 Google Classrooms accessed daily
👉More than 500 tech support calls and email requests answered
👉More than 1,900 hours of digital learning professional development completed

Each and everyone one of you should be PROUD! 🤗
#BCSCommunityOfLearners

SENIOR GRADING/GRADUATIONS/SPRING BREAK: We know that this an especially stressful time for our Senior Students.

In this video, Superintendent Dr. Oates answers several questions involving our Class of 2020, including how they will be graded this year, Graduation(and possibly Prom), and Spring Break for everyone.

Closed Captioning available here: bit.ly/SeniorsGraduationSpringBreak

We will have much more information available for students in all grades as the information is available. Please know that we are working non-stop to get students, parents, and staff as many answers to their questions as possible. In many cases due to the evolving situation involving COVID 19, the guidance has not yet been issued for us to pass along, but when we get it, we'll share it ASAP.

We are here for YOU!

#BCSCommunityOfLearners

NEED A DISTRACTION? The Brunswick County Schools Arts Alive show, featuring acts from all of our schools, was unfortunately canceled due to the state mandate to temporarily close all public schools across the state. That meant a very special presentation of artwork by students at all of our schools wouldn't be seen.

Until NOW. 🎨 This video includes more than 200 pieces of student artwork. Sit back and check out the super talented BCS students who have an amazing eye for creating masterpieces...

VIRTUAL CAREER DAY: Have you ever wondered how the Brunswick County Sheriff's Office finds fingerprints at the scene of a crime?

Check out this AWESOME behind the scenes adventure with the BCSO Criminal Investigation Unit! 🔍

Future detectives....this is for YOU! 🕵️‍♀️
#BCSCommunityOfLearners!
shared_text:
Brunswick County Sheriff's Office, NC
March 26 at 8:49 PM ·

‼️Attention students, parents, and teachers‼️

Below is another video 📹 we hope you will find interesting and educational.

Have you ever been to a Career Day where people come in and talk about their jobs?

We thought it might be fun to have a “Virtual Career Day” and have some folks here at the Sheriff’s Office describe what they do in a short video.

🕵🏻‍♂️Ever wonder what it would be like to be a real detective? Today, Detective Stephen Baize with the Sheriff’s Office Criminal Investigations Unit talks about what it takes to be a detective and even demonstrates one important tool he uses to investigate crimes.

Have a question for Det. Baize? Post your question in the comments below or email us at brunswicksheriffpio@gmail.com.

Link to YouTube: https://youtu.be/X92bbXJEcJk

Brunswick County Schools

post_text:
LET'S TALK ABOUT IT: Adults play an extremely important role in helping children cope with the unknown.
This is one of those times.

Here is some helpful advice from the experts:
🤟 Be calm and reassuring.
👂 Listen and let kids ask questions.
🚫 Avoid language that blames others.
🕐 Limit screen time on COVID-19.
💬 Provide honest, age-appropriate info.
🧼 Teach actions to reduce spread of germs.

Bonus: 💪Be their strength. They need it.
You can find more helpful information on talking with children on the CDC's website via this link: https://bit.ly/TalkingWithKidsAboutCoronavirus

HABLEMOS SOBRE ELLO: los adultos juegan un papel extremadamente importante para ayudar a los niños a hacer frente a lo desconocido.
Este es uno de esos momentos. Aquí hay algunos consejos útiles de los expertos:
🤟 Mantén la calma
👂 Escucha
🚫 Evita el lenguaje que culpe a los demás.
🕐 Limite el tiempo de pantalla en COVID-19.
💬 Proporcione información honesta y apropiada para su edad.
🧼 Enseñar acciones para reducir la propagación de gérmenes.

COMMUNITY: How wonderful is this! The Brunswick County Sheriff's Office is planning on a variety of videos for students at home, ranging from virtual tours to book readings. 👏👏👏

Sheriff Ingram gets it started with a special message and book reading. 📖
Thank you, Sheriff! We truly are a Community of Learners...

#BCSCommunityOfLearners
shared_text:
Brunswick County Sheriff's Office, NC
March 24 at 5:30 PM ·

In the upcoming weeks, the Sheriff's Office will be releasing some videos for kids and parents. Like Sheriff John W. Ingram says in the video below, many of us at the Sheriff's Office are parents and we understand the challenges of being tasked with homeschooling our children. We will be posting videos of deputies reading books, some "virtual field trips" that include K9 demos, and many other things we hope you and your children will find helpful, interesting and educational.

Please let us know if there is a topic you'd like to see covered in one of the videos.

Click the video below for a message from Sheriff Ingram followed by the Sheriff reading "Panda Bear, Panda Bear, What Do You See" by Bill Martin Jr, and Eric Carle. We hope you will share with your children!

Link to YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLIw4THQsHtuc8sFyPOWnKBb0zjx8Mbqsf

Brunswick County Schools

post_text:
STATE WINNER: A shoutout to Jessie Mae Monroe Elementary's Isaac Perry who won the North Carolina State Agriculture Calendar contest. 🎨

"Isaac is in first grade at Jessie Mae and has been a student here since kindergarten," Art Teacher Theresa Reiter said. "He is a joy to teach and just takes in everything he can learn. "

The calendar will be sent out later this year but his work(pictured) will hang permanently in the state agriculture building in Raleigh.

A little sidenote: This is the sixth time the Patriots have won in this competition and the fifth straight year! 👏👏👏

#BCSShoutout!

post_text: Here is some extremely important information from our community partners, Brunswick County Government, involving how social distancing can protect the most vulnerable...
shared_text:
Brunswick County Government
March 20 at 7:20 PM ·

It's important that we all practice social distancing and remain at home as much as possible—especially this weekend.

No matter how well you feel or how young you are, we all play a part in preventing the spread of coronvirus together. Limit your activities to those that are only essential such as attending work or grocery shopping and maintain at least six feet of distance from other people.

Find the latest and most accurate information about the novel coronavirus on the CDC, NC Department of Health and Human Services and Brunswick County channels.

https://www.brunswickcountync.gov/coronavirus/

LIVESTREAM: BCS Family, the Board of Education has called an emergency meeting to be held on Friday, March 20th for the purpose of discussing a Resolution to Grant Emergency Powers to the Superintendent.

The meeting will begin at 10:00 a.m. and will be livestreamed for the public via this link in order to comply with the recommendation for social distancing and keeping the meeting to no more than 10 people.

If the Livestream has technical issues during the broadcast, we will have the video available shortly after the meeting concludes on the BCS Youtube page as well as included in this evening's daily update on the district website. Link below...

https://livestream.com/brunswickcountyschools/boeemergencymeetingmarch20

TECH CHECK: Today Brunswick County Schools checked out more than 2700 devices for student use while schools are closed. 😲📱💻

Parents who were unable to pick up devices may schedule an appointment with their child's school for pick up on Tuesday between the hours of 9:00 am and 2:00 pm. Please make sure you call and schedule an appointment with the school. West Brunswick High School will have a special checkout window of Tuesday 2 pm - 5 pm and Wednesday 5-7 pm.

Also, the district is working on troubleshooting guides for students and parents to help with the tech. We will post these as soon as they are complete. Please have a little patience during this time as we try to troubleshoot individual issues with devices at home and we'll continue to get helpful information out to you as soon as it's available.

(And check out all these online educational resources available to the students:
http://bit.ly/OnlineEducationalResources)

Please make sure you call and schedule an appointment with the school. West Brunswick High School will have a special checkout window of Tuesday 2 pm - 5 pm and Wednesday 5-7 pm.

Also, the district is working on troubleshooting guides for students and parents to help with the tech. We will post these as soon as they are complete. Please have a little patience during this time as we try to troubleshoot individual issues with devices at home and we'll continue to get helpful information out to you as soon as it's available.

(And check out all these online educational resources available to the students:
http://bit.ly/OnlineEducationalResources)

BCSWAN.NET
Online Educational Resources/Video Tutorials

post_text:
STUDENT MEAL PICKUPS: Brunswick County Schools will be providing pickup meals for students throughout the school closures.

Parents can pickup meals by coming to one of the centrally located high school sites, Monday-Friday, from 11am-1pm.

➡️NBHS: 114 Scorpion Drive Leland, NC 28451
➡️WBHS: 550 Whiteville Road Shallotte, NC 28470
➡️SBHS: 280 Cougar Drive, BSL Southport, NC 28461

We ask that Parents stay in their car and packaged breakfast and lunch meals will be brought out to them. There will be no charge to our families.

We'll have additional information on meal distribution as it becomes available.

Las escuelas del condado de Brunswick están cerradas hasta el 30 de marzo. Las comidas para llevar a casa para todos los estudiantes están disponibles para que las recojan en nuestras escuelas secundarias de lunes a viernes de 11 a.m. a 1 p.m.

3/14/2020 UPDATE: In following the guidance of North Carolina Governor Roy Cooper, Brunswick County Schools will be closed beginning Monday, March 16th, until March 30th, 2020.
Monday will be an optional workday for staff.
We will have more information for students, parents, staff and community members as soon as possible.
This is an evolving situation and we are dedicated to making sure students remain healthy and engaged during this time frame.

TEAMWORK: A little collaboration between High School Science Instructional Coach Dr. Jamie Smith and South Brunswick High School Science Teacher Nicole Bertges leads to some new educational games for the classroom!

The two were awarded a $3000 PRISM grant from the Burroughs Wellcome Fund. Dr. Smith says the grant will be used to purchase breakout kits for the science department in order to provide students with immersive learning games that bring the challenges of escape rooms to the classroom.

Challenge accepted! 👏👏👏
#BCSShoutout!

ENCORE EDUCATION: Did you know it can be considered chronic absenteeism if a student misses 2 days of school a month?

In this month's Encore Education webinar, Brunswick County Schools Counselors, Social Workers, and MTSS Coordinators discuss excessive absentees, tardies, early pickups and how we can all work together to make sure students get the instructional class time they all deserve.

Closed Captioning here: http://bit.ly/EncoreEdAbsenteeism
Resources mentioned in Episode 2 here: www.bcswan.net/EncoreEducation

24/7 HELPLINE: Do you have a question regarding the Coronavirus? The NC Division of Public Health has a statewide helpline staffed 24 hours a day, 7 days a week with a variety of experts who can assist you(1-866-462-3821).

Locally, Brunswick County Schools continues to monitor the situation in partnership with the Brunswick County Health and Human Services Department, under the guidance of the NC Department of Health and Human Services (DHHS) and the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC).

County and State health officials have assured us that we should maintain our regular, routine cleaning procedures in our schools. They've stressed to us that we should approach the Coronavirus (COVID-19) the same as influenza.

You can find numerous helpful resources via this link: https://www.brunswickcountync.gov/health/coronavirus/

post_text:
DEDICATION: How about a shoutout to the Science Olympiad coaches! 👏👏👏

The Regional Science Olympiad Tournament was held this weekend at UNCW and you can find some great photos of the students in action with medals on display on some of the middle school Facebook pages.

Here we find the Brunswick County Schools Middle School and High School Coaches huddled for a group photo during the event. 😍

"These Science Olympiad coaches volunteer endless hours and work selflessly to promote STEM through Science Olympiad for their students," Instructional Coach-Middle School Science Sarah Calderado said of their daily dedication. "They are a huge asset to Brunswick County Schools and Brunswick County STEM."

Thank You, Educators ❤️!

They helped lead students with some exciting activities at the regionals over the weekend. Teams participated and placed in a variety of events including genetics, earth science, chemistry, anatomy, physics, geology, mechanical engineering and technology.

#BCSShoutout!

post_text:
SCHOOL RESOURCE AWESOMERS: The Brunswick County Sheriff's Office School Resource Officers are an amazing part of the BCS Family.

Thank YOU for your dedication to providing safety and role models to students and staff at every single school in the Brunswick County Schools district! 🤗

Check them out in #ReadAcrossAmerica fashion...😍

#BCSShoutout!
shared_text:
Brunswick County Sheriff's Office, NC
March 6 at 9:47 PM ·

We’re not sure who had more fun this week celebrating Dr. Seuss’ birthday and Reading Across America - the awesome students at Brunswick County Schools or our SROs!

Our SROs not only keep our children and school personnel safe, they also get involved with the various activities at the schools. They believe being part of the school they serve is extremely important and that getting to know the children creates a deeper trust and more positive impression of law enforcement. Our SROs establish very strong bonds and become extremely fond of “their” students. We are grateful to BCS for their partnership with us!

post_text:
TEAMWORK: It was a chilly way to celebrate and support the Special Olympics but that didn't detour hundreds of school and community members from taking the Polar Plunge last weekend in Oak Island. ❄️🌊

Pictured is the Waccamaw School team who single-handedly raised, get this, more than $3,600 for the cause! 👏👏👏

"Many general education teachers, specialists, and all of the Exceptional Children's teachers were present at the event to represent our team," BCS Speech-Language Pathologist Erin Cook said of the teamwork, "and the entire school and community worked together to raise the money."

Way to make the inaugural "Freezin' for a Reason" event for Special Olympics Brunswick County a major success, Eagles!!! 🦅
#BCSShoutout!

"Many general education teachers, specialists, and all of the Exceptional Children's teachers were present at the event to represent our team," BCS Speech-Language Pathologist Erin Cook said of the teamwork, "and the entire school and community worked together to raise the money."

Way to make the inaugural "Freezin' for a Reason" event for Special Olympics Brunswick County a major success, Eagles!!! 🦅
#BCSShoutout!

OF THE YEAR: A big round of applause for Brunswick County Schools Director of Instructional Technology, Acacia Dixon!
👏👏👏
Ms. Dixon was just named the North Carolina Technology Director of the Year by NC Public Schools, NCTIES, NCET, and NCCoSN for her continued work to transform student learning through the integration of technology. 💻

The award was presented to Ms. Dixon during the Annual State Technology Directors' Meeting at the Raleigh Convention Center March 4th, 2020.

Congratulations, Acacia Dixon! The future is oh so bright for Brunswick County Schools ☀️😎

post_text:
GOVERNOR'S SCHOOL: The state finalists for Governor's School 2020 have been named and 8 Brunswick County Schools students are on the list! 👏👏👏

The following students will participate for five weeks this summer at one of the two campus sites that will provide the country's most respected residential program for academics, arts, and leadership.

Brunswick County Early College High School:
👉Simon Lagas-Rivera in Natural Science at West Campus
👉Mary MacGowan in Social Science at West Campus
South Brunswick High School:
👉Trinity Cottle in Choral Music (Soprano 2) at East Campus
👉Sam Myers in Instrumental Music (Trombone) at West Campus
👉Aubrey Sherrod in Math at West Campus
👉Wren Whalen in Instrumental Music (Clarinet) at East Campus
West Brunswick High School Trojans:
👉John DeStefano in Social Science at East Campus
👉Ria Sanchez in Natural Science at West Campus

The student finalists were assigned either the West Campus, which is High Point University in High Point, NC, or the East Campus, which is Meredith College in Raleigh, NC:

BLOOM, THERE IT IS: Congratulations, Ms. Jinwright, on taking home CTE Door Decorating Contest honors! College dreams do bloom at Cedar Grove Middle School ❤️

Career and Technical Education (CTE) courses provide students skills that open numerous doors of opportunity around the world. Current program areas in the district include: Agricultural Education, Business, Finance, Information Technology Education, Career Development Education, Family & Consumer Sciences Education, Health Science Education, Marketing and Entrepreneurship Education, Technology, Engineering and Design Education, and Trade and Industrial Education.

Want to know more about the Brunswick County Schools CTE Department? Click here: http://bit.ly/BCSandCTE
#BCSShoutout!

March 3 at 1:30 PM ·

Congratulations to Mrs. Jinwright for winning the CTE door decorating contest for BCS! CONGRATULATIONS: A BIG round of applause to The Center of Applied Sciences and Technology for being honored with the "Leadership in Diversity Award" presented by the Brunswick County Chamber of Commerce! 👏👏👏

"On behalf of the administration and Board of Education, I congratulate you all for your work and dedication to being champions for students by improving their future outcomes through innovative, personalized, and relevant instruction," Principal Randy Horne said of the award.

The Leadership in Diversity award honors an exceptional company who is leading programs that foster diversity in the workplace and championing underrepresented groups.

Pictured are Principal Horne and BCS School Board Chair Ellen Milligan after the award was given out at the BC Chamber of Commerce Chairman's Award Presentation Gala.

Want to know more about the courses at The COAST? Click here: http://bit.ly/TheCOASTBCS

#BCSShoutout

text:
SURPRISE SURPRISE: Look who popped in the land of the Dolphins to say "thank you" for innovative, dedicated, & creative thinking!

Superintendent Dr. Oates dropped off a token of #IFiredBenDoing appreciation for Southport Elementary School Head Custodian Gene Knoblauch and PTA President Melissa Sherrod for their help creating the sensory hall "Activity Avenue". 😍

You can watch their video spotlight here on the BCS Facebook page in the video section or via this link: http://bit.ly/ActivityAvenue

For more information on the #IFiredBenDoing movement, check out Dr. Oates's Blog that talks all about it: http://bit.ly/WhyIFiredBenDoing)

Who will be next? 😎

#BCSShoutout!

post_text:
HOLE IN ONE: The First Tee of Coastal Carolinas is swinging new ideas for days when schools are closed (like the upcoming Teacher Workday on Friday, Feb 28th.)

Call 910-754-5288 for more info 🏌️‍♀️🏌️‍♂️
